fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Enter Order Message Id.

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: Token must be unique for each OUCH user per trading cycle.

fields.name: Broker Reference
fields.notes: Assigned by Participant. It is not checked but returned via the Accepted sequenced message and also forwarded to the downstream systems.

fields.name: Investor Id
fields.notes: Assigned by the Participant. This field is forwarded to the clearing and settlement venues. There is no validation of this field, it is simply passed through to the depended systems. This maps to the SID value.

fields.name: Order Verb
fields.notes: ‘B’uy ‘S’ell Shor’T’ Sell ‘P’rice Stabilisation (only buy) ‘M’argin (only buy)

fields.name: Order Source
fields.notes: Expected format = `ABCD`

fields.name: Domicile
fields.notes: ‘I’ndonesia, ‘A’sing (foreigner), ‘S’endiri (house), ‘F’oreigner house.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.notes: Total number of lots. Maximum value 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

fields.name: Orderbook
fields.notes: Unique orderbook identifier. Unsigned big-endian binary encoded.

fields.name: Price
fields.notes: The price of this order. The price is 0x7FFFFFFF for a ‘market’ order. Only positive value and maximum price for a ‘limit’ order is 0x7FFFFFFF -1

fields.name: Time in Force
fields.notes: 99997 – session 99998 - day Any other values are not supported (order will be rejected).

fields.name: Client Id
fields.notes: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Replace Order Message Id.

fields.name: Existing Order Token
fields.notes: The token to match exactly with the original Enter Order or Replace Order Message.

fields.name: Replacement Order Token
fields.notes: Token must be unique for each OUCH user per trading cycle.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.notes: Total number of lots liable, inclusive of previous executions on this order chain. The maximum in the chain being 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

fields.name: Price
fields.notes: The price of the replacement order. The price is 0x7FFFFFFF (hex) 2147483647 (dec) for a ‘market’ order. Only positive value and maximum price for a ‘limit’ order is 0x7FFFFFFF -1

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Cancel Order Message Id.

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: The exact match for the original order token from the Order Entry message.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Trading Limit Message Id.

fields.name: Trading Limit Type
fields.notes: ‘P’ool ‘E’quity ‘D’erivative

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: System Event Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as number of nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Event Code
fields.notes: “S” start of day “E” end of day

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Accepted Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as number of nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: The order token field as entered

fields.name: Broker Reference
fields.notes: Assigned by Participant on the order entry message.

fields.name: Investor Id
fields.notes: The Investor Id field as entered. Maps to SID.

fields.name: Order Verb
fields.notes: ‘B’uy ‘S’ell Shor’T’ Sell ‘P’rice Stabilisation (only buy) ‘M’argin (only buy)

fields.name: Order Source
fields.notes: Expected format = `ABCD`

fields.name: Domicile
fields.notes: ‘I’ndonesia, ‘A’sing (foreigner), ‘S’endiri (house), ‘F’oreigner house.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.notes: Total number of lots accepted.

fields.name: Orderbook
fields.notes: Unique orderbook identifier as entered.

fields.name: Price
fields.notes: The accepted price of the order. The price is 0x7FFFFFFF (hex) or 2147483647 (dec) for a ‘market’ order.

fields.name: Time in Force
fields.notes: 0 – immediate 99997 - session 99998 – day Any other values are not supported

fields.name: Client Id
fields.notes: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: Order Reference Number
fields.notes: Day unique order reference number.

fields.name: Order Reference Number External
fields.notes: Day unique order reference number as displayed on ITCH Total View.

fields.name: Order State
fields.notes: “L”ive or “D”ead. No further Canceled message will be received for the accepted order.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Replaced Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as number of nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Replacement Order Token
fields.notes: The Replacement Order Token field.

fields.name: Order Verb
fields.notes: ‘B’uy ‘S’ell Shor’T’ Sell ‘P’rice Stabilisation (only buy) ‘M’argin (only buy) on original order.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.notes: The accepted quantity of the replacement.

fields.name: Orderbook
fields.notes: Unique orderbook identifier as entered on the replace message.

fields.name: Price
fields.notes: The accepted price of the replacement. 0x7FFFFFFF (hex) or 2147483647 (dec) for a ‘market’ order.

fields.name: Time in Force
fields.notes: 99997 - session 99998 – day Any other values are not supported.

fields.name: Order Reference Number
fields.notes: Day unique order reference number.

fields.name: Order Reference Number External
fields.notes: Day unique order reference number as displayed on ITCH Total View.

fields.name: Order State
fields.notes: “L”ive or “D”ead. If the replaced quantity is equal to the executed quantity, OrderReplaced message is sent with value “Dead”. OrderReplaced message is also sent with value “Dead” for an IOC order which fails to execute. No further Canceled message will be received for the replaced order.

fields.name: Previous Order Token
fields.notes: The Order Token of the order that was replaced.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Canceled Order Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as the number of nanoseconds past midnight

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: The Order Token of the order being canceled.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.notes: Number of lots canceled. This is balance of the order when the cancel transaction was processed.

fields.name: Reason
fields.notes: Reason the order was cancelled. Refer to Cancelled Reasons below.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Order Executed Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as the number of nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: The Order Token of the executed order.

fields.name: Executed Quantity
fields.notes: Incremental quantity executed, i.e. the quantity for this execution only.

fields.name: Executed Price
fields.notes: The executed price for executed quantity.

fields.name: Liquidity Flag
fields.notes: “A”dded for the passive firm (resting order), “R”emoved for the aggressor, “U”ncross for auction executions.

fields.name: Match Number
fields.notes: Match identifier for each trade. Same for buy/sell sides. This is the X-stream INET Trading trade number.

fields.name: Counter Party ID
fields.notes: Depending on the orderbook setup the counterparty identifier may contain a masking CCP or a trading counterparty.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Broken Trade Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as the number of nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: The Order Token of the order for which the given Match Number is being broken.

fields.name: Match Number
fields.notes: Match identifier for each trade. Same for buy/sell sides. This is the X-stream INET Trading trade number.

fields.name: Reason
fields.notes: The reason the trade was broken. See currently supported Broken Trade Reasons table below.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Rejected Order Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Order Token
fields.notes: Order Token field as was entered.

fields.name: Reason
fields.notes: The reason the order was rejected. Refer to Rejected Order Reasons below.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Trading Limit Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Trading Limit Type
fields.notes: ‘P’ool ‘E’quity ‘D’erivative

fields.name: Used
fields.notes: The used value for the trading limit. Not set is 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

fields.name: Traded
fields.notes: The traded value for the trading limit. Not set is 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

fields.name: Limit
fields.notes: The limit value for the trading limit. Not set is 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

fields.name: Type
fields.notes: Trading Limit Message Id.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.notes: Timestamp – reflected as nanoseconds past midnight.

fields.name: Trading Limit Type
fields.notes: ‘P’ool ‘E’quity ‘D’erivative

fields.name: Used
fields.notes: The used value for the trading limit. Not set is 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

fields.name: Traded
fields.notes: The traded value for the trading limit. Not set is 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

fields.name: Limit
fields.notes: The limit value for the trading limit. Not set is 0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.

items.value: Cancel Order: User requested the order to be cancelled. Sent in response to a Cancel Order message or a Replace Order Message
Cancel Order: Timeout. Session/day order got expired
Cancel Order: Supervisory. For example, emergency withdraw or the user got suspended
Replace Order: Invalid quantity or quantity exceeds maximum limit
Replace Order: The order is not allowed at this time
Replace Order: Invalid Order Type. For example, the Time In Force value is not supported in current trading session
Replace Order: Unknown. Contact support for further information
Consent – The two parties mutually agreed to break the trade.
Supervisory – The trade was manually broken by Star PX Exchange supervisory.
The orderbook, instrument, board or market is not tradeable.
Invalid quantity or quantity exceeds maximum limit.
The order is not allowed at this time.
Invalid Order Type. For example, the Time In Force value is not supported in current trading session.
Flow control in place for user. A throttle is active for this OUCH port.
The order has exceeded the firm trading limits.
Unknown. Contact support for further information.
